An alternative title for many Sumerian rulers was ensi, perhaps ‘‘steward’’; the term originally referred to the mortal ruler’s role as representative and steward of the patron god of the city who was the real ruler. Its meaning was somewhat ambiguous, because an ensi of the god was supreme ruler on earth, but an ensi might also be a representative or steward for another earthly ruler
